text: What is the primary goal of non-functional testing?

options.1: To evaluate how the system performs under various conditions, such as speed, reliability, and security.
options.2: To validate the functional requirements of the system.
options.3: To test individual units of code in isolation.
options.4: To verify the integration between different modules of the system.

text: Which of the following is a type of non-functional testing?

options.2: Integration testing.
options.4: Sanity testing.

text: What is the main focus of performance testing?

options.1: To verify the security of the system.
options.2: To evaluate the system's speed, responsiveness, and stability under workload.
options.3: To test the usability of the system.
options.4: To validate the integration between modules.

text: Which environment is most suitable for performance testing?

options.2: User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
options.4: A dedicated performance testing environment that mimics production.

text: What is the purpose of security testing?

options.1: To identify vulnerabilities and ensure the system is protected against threats.
options.2: To test the system's compliance with business requirements.
options.3: To validate the integration between modules.
options.4: To evaluate the system's usability.

text: Which tool is commonly used for security testing?

options.2: JMeter.
options.4: JUnit.

text: What is the main focus of usability testing?

options.1: To evaluate the system's performance under load.
options.2: To validate the integration between modules.
options.4: To assess how user-friendly and intuitive the system is.

text: In which environment is usability testing typically performed?

options.2: User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
options.4: System Integration Testing (SIT).

text: What is the difference between load testing and stress testing?

options.1: Load testing evaluates system performance under expected workload, while stress testing evaluates system behavior under extreme conditions.
options.2: Load testing focuses on security, while stress testing focuses on usability.
options.3: Load testing is performed in UAT, while stress testing is performed in PROD.
options.4: There is no difference; both are the same.

text: Which tool is commonly used for performance testing?

options.2: JMeter.
options.4: Selenium.

text: What is the purpose of scalability testing?

options.2: To evaluate the system's usability.
options.3: To determine how well the system can handle increased workload or growth.
options.4: To validate the integration between modules.

text: Which of the following is a non-functional requirement?

options.1: The system must allow users to log in.
options.2: The system must integrate with a payment gateway.
options.3: The system must display product details.
options.4: The system must handle 1,000 concurrent users.

text: What is the main focus of reliability testing?

options.2: To ensure the system operates without failure over a specified period.
options.4: To validate the integration between modules.

text: Which type of testing evaluates the system's ability to recover from failures?

options.2: Usability testing.
options.4: Security testing.

text: What is the purpose of compatibility testing?

options.1: To ensure the system works across different devices, browsers, and operating systems.
options.2: To evaluate the system's performance under load.
options.4: To validate the integration between modules.

text: Which of the following is an example of a non-functional test case?

options.1: Verify that the login functionality works with valid credentials.
options.2: Check that the payment gateway integration processes payments correctly.
options.3: Ensure that the product details page displays all required information.
options.4: Verify that the system responds within 2 seconds under 500 concurrent users.

options.2: To test the system's usability.

options.2: User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
options.4: A dedicated testing environment that mimics production.
